   20: 
   21: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   22: %%% File    : erlexec_SUITE.erl
   23: %%% Author  : Rickard Green <rickard.s.green@ericsson.com>
   24: %%% Description : Test erlexec's command line parsing
   25: %%%
   26: %%% Created : 22 May 2007 by Rickard Green <rickard.s.green@ericsson.com>
   27: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   28: -module(erlexec_SUITE).
   29: 
   30: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   31:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   32: 
   33: -export([args_file/1, evil_args_file/1, missing_args_file/1, env/1, args_file_env/1,
   34:          otp_7461/1, otp_7461_remote/1, argument_separation/1, argument_with_option/1,
   35:          zdbbl_dist_buf_busy_limit/1, long_path_env/1, long_path_env_when_rootdir_not_present/1]).
   36: 
   37: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   38: 
   39: suite() ->
   40:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   41:      {timetrap, {minutes, 1}}].
   42: 
   43: all() ->
   44:     [args_file, evil_args_file, missing_args_file, env, args_file_env,
   45:      otp_7461, argument_separation, argument_with_option, zdbbl_dist_buf_busy_limit,
   46:      long_path_env, long_path_env_when_rootdir_not_present].
   47: 
   48: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   49:     [{suite_erl_flags, save_env()} | Config].
   50: 
   51: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   52:     SavedEnv = proplists:get_value(suite_erl_flags, Config),
   53:     restore_env(SavedEnv).
   54: 
   55: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
   56:     SavedEnv = save_env(),
   57:     [{testcase, Case},{erl_flags_env, SavedEnv}|Config].
   58: 
   59: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   60:     SavedEnv = proplists:get_value(erl_flags_env, Config),
   61:     restore_env(SavedEnv),
   62:     cleanup_nodes(),
   63:     ok.
   64: 
   65: %% Test that plain first argument does not
   66: %% destroy -home switch [OTP-8209] or interact with environments
   67: argument_separation(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   68:     {ok,[[FullPName]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
   69:      %% progname can be either "erl" or "cerl -asan", so we remove anything after the first space.
   70:      %% This will break if tests are run with an erlang that has a space in the path...
   71:     [PName | _ ] = string:lexemes(FullPName," "),
   72:     SNameS = "erlexec_test_01",
   73:     SName = list_to_atom(SNameS++"@"++
   74: 			 hd(tl(string:lexemes(atom_to_list(node()),"@")))),
   75:     Cmd = PName ++ " cmd_param -sname "++SNameS++" -setcookie "++
   76: 	atom_to_list(erlang:get_cookie()) ++ " -cmd_test",
   77:     open_port({spawn,Cmd},[{env,[{"ERL_AFLAGS","-atest"},
   78:                                  {"ERL_FLAGS","env_param -test"},
   79:                                  {"ERL_ZFLAGS","zenv_param"}]}]),
   80:     pong = loop_ping(SName,40),
   81:     ct:log("emu_args: ~p",[rpc:call(SName,erlang,system_info,[emu_args])]),
   82:     {ok,[[_]]} = rpc:call(SName,init,get_argument,[home]),
   83:     {ok,[[]]} = rpc:call(SName,init,get_argument,[atest]),
   84:     {ok,[[]]} = rpc:call(SName,init,get_argument,[cmd_test]),
   85:     {ok,[[]]} = rpc:call(SName,init,get_argument,[test]),
   86:     error = rpc:call(SName,init,get_argument,[unknown]),
   87:     ["cmd_param","env_param","zenv_param"] = rpc:call(SName,init,get_plain_arguments,[]),
   88:     ok = cleanup_nodes(),
   89:     ok.
   90: 
   91: cleanup_nodes() ->
   92:     cleanup_node("erlexec_test_01",20).
   93: cleanup_node(SNameS,0) ->
   94:     {error, {would_not_die,list_to_atom(SNameS)}};
   95: cleanup_node(SNameS,N) ->
   96:     SName = list_to_atom(SNameS++"@"++
   97: 			 hd(tl(string:lexemes(atom_to_list(node()),"@")))),
   98:     case rpc:call(SName,init,stop,[]) of
   99: 	{badrpc,_} ->
  100: 	    ok;
  101: 	ok ->
  102: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
  103: 	    cleanup_node(SNameS,N-1)
  104:     end.
  105: 
  106: loop_ping(_,0) ->
  107:     flush(),
  108:     pang;
  109: loop_ping(Node,N) ->
  110:     case net_adm:ping(Node) of
  111: 	pang ->
  112: 	    receive
  113: 	    after 500 ->
  114: 		    ok
  115: 	    end,
  116: 	    loop_ping(Node, N-1);
  117: 	pong ->
  118: 	    pong
  119:     end.
  120: 
  121: flush() ->
  122:     receive M ->
  123:             ct:pal("~p",[M]),
  124:             flush()
  125:     after 10 ->
  126:             ok
  127:     end.
  128: 
  129: %% Test that giving an invalid argument to an option that needs
  130: %% an argument will always fail.
  131: argument_with_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  132:     ErlSingle = ["emu_flavor", "emu_type", "configfd", "epmd",
  133:                  "name", "sname", "start_epmd"] ++
  134:         case os:type() of
  135:             {win32,_} -> ["boot","config","service_event"];
  136:             _ -> []
  137:         end,
  138: 
  139:     MissingCheck =
  140:         fun(CmdLine, Prefix, Postfix) ->
  141:                 InvalidArg = emu_args("-s init stop " ++ Prefix ++ CmdLine ++ Postfix,
  142:                                       [return_output]),
  143:                 case re:run(InvalidArg, "Missing argument\\(s\\) for '\\" ++ Prefix ++ CmdLine ++ "'.") of
  144:                     nomatch ->
  145:                         ct:log("Output: ~ts",[InvalidArg]),
  146:                         ct:fail("Failed to fail on ~ts",[Prefix ++ CmdLine ++ Postfix]);
  147:                     {match,_} ->
  148:                         ok
  149:                 end
  150:         end,
  151: 
  152:     [begin
  153:          MissingCheck(CmdLine,"-",""),
  154: 
  155:          %% We test what happens when ERL_FLAGS is set
  156:          os:putenv("ERL_FLAGS","-test"),
  157:          MissingCheck(CmdLine,"-", ""),
  158:          os:unsetenv("ERL_FLAGS")
  159:      end || CmdLine <- ErlSingle],
  160: 
  161:     EmuSingle = ["a", "A", "C", "e", "i", "n", "P", "Q", "t",
  162:                  "T", "R", "W", "K", "IOt", "IOp", "IOPt", "IOPp",
  163:                  "J", "SP", "SDcpu", "SDPcpu", "SDio",
  164:                  "hms", "rg", "sbt", "zdbbl"],
  165: 
  166:     [begin
  167:          MissingCheck(CmdLine,"+",""),
  168: 
  169:          %% We test what happens when ERL_FLAGS is set
  170:          os:putenv("ERL_FLAGS","-test"),
  171:          MissingCheck(CmdLine,"+", ""),
  172:          os:unsetenv("ERL_FLAGS")
  173:      end || CmdLine <- EmuSingle],
  174: 
  175:     ErlDouble = ["env"],
  176: 
  177:     [begin
  178:          MissingCheck(CmdLine,"-",""),
  179:          MissingCheck(CmdLine,"-"," a"),
  180: 
  181:          %% We test what happens when ERL_FLAGS is set
  182:          os:putenv("ERL_FLAGS","-test"),
  183:          MissingCheck(CmdLine,"-", ""),
  184:          MissingCheck(CmdLine,"-", " a"),
  185:          os:unsetenv("ERL_FLAGS")
  186:      end || CmdLine <- ErlDouble],
  187:     ok.
  188: 
  189: args_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  190:     AFN1 = privfile("1", Config),
  191:     AFN2 = privfile("2", Config),
  192:     AFN3 = privfile("3", Config),
  193:     AFN4 = privfile("4", Config),
  194:     AFN5 = privfile("5", Config),
  195:     AFN6 = privfile("6", Config),
  196:     write_file(AFN1, "-MiscArg2~n"
  197: 		     "# a comment +\\#1000~n"
  198: 		     "+\\#200 # another comment~n"
  199: 		     "~n"
  200: 		     "# another config file to read~n"
  201: 		     " -args_file ~s#acomment~n"
  202: 		     "~n"
  203: 		     "-MiscArg7~n"
  204: 		     "-MiscArg8 'val  with  double   space'~n"
  205: 		     "-MiscArg9 '~n'~n"
  206: 		     "-MiscArg10 \\~n\\\t~n"
  207: 		     "#~n"
  208: 		     "+\\#700~n"
  209:                      "#~s~n"
  210: 		     "-extra +XtraArg6~n",
  211: 	       [AFN2,lists:duplicate(1024*1024, $a)]),
  212:     write_file(AFN2,
  213: 		     "-MiscArg3 \t\v\f\r\n   ~n"
  214: 		     "+\\#300~n"
  215: 		     "-args_file ~s~n"
  216: 		     "-MiscArg5 ' '~n"
  217: 		     "+\\#500#anothercomment -MiscArg11~n"
  218: 		     "-args_file ~s~n"
  219: 		     "-args_file ~s~n"
  220: 		     "-args_file ~s~n"
  221:                      "# ~s~n"
  222: 		     "-extra +XtraArg5~n",
  223: 		     [AFN3, AFN4, AFN5, AFN6,lists:duplicate(1758, $a)]),
  224:     write_file(AFN3,
  225: 		     "# comment again~n"
  226: 		     " -MiscArg4 +\\#400 -extra +XtraArg1"),
  227:     write_file(AFN4,
  228: 		     " -MiscArg6 +\\#600 -extra +XtraArg2~n"
  229: 		     "+XtraArg3~n"
  230: 		     "+XtraArg4~n"
  231: 		     "# comment again~n"),
  232:     write_file(AFN5, ""),
  233:     write_file(AFN6, "-extra # +XtraArg10~n"),
  234:     CmdLine = "+#100 -MiscArg1 "
  235: 	++ "-args_file " ++ AFN1
  236: 	++ " +#800 -MiscArgCLI \\\t -extra +XtraArg7 +XtraArg8",
  237:     {Emu, Misc, Extra} = emu_args(CmdLine),
  238:     verify_args(["-#100", "-#200", "-#300", "-#400",
  239: 		       "-#500", "-#600", "-#700", "-#800"], Emu),
  240:     verify_args(["-MiscArg1", "-MiscArg2", "-MiscArg3", "-MiscArg4",
  241:                  "-MiscArg5", " ", "-MiscArg6", "-MiscArg7", "-MiscArg8",
  242:                  "val  with  double   space",
  243:                  "-MiscArg9","\n","-MiscArg10","\n\t","-MiscArgCLI"],
  244: 		      Misc),
  245:     verify_args(["+XtraArg1", "+XtraArg2", "+XtraArg3", "+XtraArg4",
  246: 		       "+XtraArg5", "+XtraArg6", "+XtraArg7", "+XtraArg8"],
  247: 		      Extra),
  248:     verify_not_args(["","-MiscArg11", "-#1000", "+XtraArg10",
  249: 			   "-MiscArg1", "-MiscArg2", "-MiscArg3", "-MiscArg4",
  250: 			   "-MiscArg5", "-MiscArg6", "-MiscArg7", "-MiscArg8",
  251:                            "-MiscArg9", "-MiscArg10","-MiscArgCLI",
  252: 			   "+XtraArg1", "+XtraArg2", "+XtraArg3", "+XtraArg4",
  253: 			   "+XtraArg5", "+XtraArg6", "+XtraArg7", "+XtraArg8"],
  254: 			  Emu),
  255:     verify_not_args(["","-MiscArg11", "-#1000", "+XtraArg10",
  256: 			   "-#100", "-#200", "-#300", "-#400",
  257: 			   "-#500", "-#600", "-#700", "-#800",
  258: 			   "+XtraArg1", "+XtraArg2", "+XtraArg3", "+XtraArg4",
  259: 			   "+XtraArg5", "+XtraArg6", "+XtraArg7", "+XtraArg8"],
  260: 			  Misc),
  261:     verify_not_args(["","-MiscArg11", "-#1000", "+XtraArg10",
  262: 			   "-#100", "-#200", "-#300", "-#400",
  263: 			   "-#500", "-#600", "-#700", "-#800",
  264: 			   "-MiscArg1", "-MiscArg2", "-MiscArg3", "-MiscArg4",
  265: 			   "-MiscArg5", "-MiscArg6", "-MiscArg7", "-MiscArg8",
  266:                            "-MiscArg9","-MiscArg10","-MiscArgCLI"],
  267: 			  Extra),
  268:     ok.
  269: 
  270: evil_args_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  271:     Lim = 300,
  272:     FNums = lists:seq(1, Lim),
  273:     lists:foreach(fun (End) when End == Lim ->
  274: 			  AFN = privfile(integer_to_list(End), Config),
  275: 			  write_file(AFN,
  276: 					   "-MiscArg~p ",
  277: 					   [End]);
  278: 		      (I) ->
  279: 			  AFNX = privfile(integer_to_list(I), Config),
  280: 			  AFNY = privfile(integer_to_list(I+1), Config),
  281: 			  {Frmt, Args} =
  282: 			      case I rem 2 of
  283: 				  0 ->
  284: 				      {"-MiscArg~p -args_file ~s -MiscArg~p",
  285: 				       [I, AFNY, I]};
  286: 				  _ ->
  287: 				      {"-MiscArg~p -args_file ~s",
  288: 				       [I, AFNY]}
  289: 			      end,
  290: 			  write_file(AFNX, Frmt, Args)
  291: 		  end,
  292: 		  FNums),
  293:     {_Emu, Misc, _Extra} = emu_args("-args_file "
  294: 					  ++ privfile("1", Config)),
  295:     ANums = FNums
  296: 	++ lists:reverse(lists:filter(fun (I) when I == Lim -> false;
  297: 					  (I) when I rem 2 == 0 -> true;
  298: 					  (_) -> false
  299: 				      end, FNums)),
  300:     verify_args(lists:map(fun (I) -> "-MiscArg"++integer_to_list(I) end,
  301: 				ANums),
  302: 		      Misc),
  303:     ok.
  304: 
  305: missing_args_file(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  306:     % supply an unexisting args file as parameter
  307:     CmdLine = "-args_file "++ "missing_vm_args_file",
  308:     % we're expecting a failure, capture the output
  309:     % and check for the correct error message
  310:     Output = emu_args(CmdLine, [return_output]),
  311:     % the output message format in case of failure can be consulted
  312:     % at read_args_file@erts/etc/common/erlexec.c
  313:     case re:run(Output, "Failed to open arguments file [^ ]+ at [^ ]+: No such file or directory.*") of
  314:         {match,[{0, MatchEnd}]} when MatchEnd > 0 ->
  315:             % a simple match on the regex is sufficient to decide
  316:             % that the output is properly formatted
  317:             ok;
  318:         Error ->
  319:             exit({unexpected_args_output, Output, Error})
  320:     end.
  321: 
  322: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  323:     os:putenv("ERL_AFLAGS", "-MiscArg1 +#100 -extra +XtraArg1 +XtraArg2"),
  324:     CmdLine = "+#200 -MiscArg2 -extra +XtraArg3 +XtraArg4",
  325:     os:putenv("ERL_FLAGS", "-MiscArg3 +#300 -extra +XtraArg5"),
  326:     os:putenv("ERL_ZFLAGS", "-MiscArg4 +#400 -extra +XtraArg6"),
  327:     {Emu, Misc, Extra} = emu_args(CmdLine),
  328:     verify_args(["-#100", "-#200", "-#300", "-#400"], Emu),
  329:     verify_args(["-MiscArg1", "-MiscArg2", "-MiscArg3", "-MiscArg4"],
  330: 		      Misc),
  331:     verify_args(["+XtraArg1", "+XtraArg2", "+XtraArg3", "+XtraArg4",
  332: 		       "+XtraArg5", "+XtraArg6"],
  333: 		      Extra),
  334:     ok.
  335: 
  336: args_file_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  337:     AFN1 = privfile("1", Config),
  338:     AFN2 = privfile("2", Config),
  339:     write_file(AFN1, "-MiscArg2 +\\#200 -extra +XtraArg1"),
  340:     write_file(AFN2, "-MiscArg3 +\\#400 -extra +XtraArg3"),
  341:     os:putenv("ERL_AFLAGS",
  342: 		    "-MiscArg1 +#100 -args_file "++AFN1++ " -extra +XtraArg2"),
  343:     CmdLine = "+#300 -args_file "++AFN2++" -MiscArg4 -extra +XtraArg4",
  344:     os:putenv("ERL_FLAGS", "-MiscArg5 +#500 -extra +XtraArg5"),
  345:     os:putenv("ERL_ZFLAGS", "-MiscArg6 +#600 -extra +XtraArg6"),
  346:     {Emu, Misc, Extra} = emu_args(CmdLine),
  347:     verify_args(["-#100", "-#200", "-#300", "-#400",
  348: 		       "-#500", "-#600"], Emu),
  349:     verify_args(["-MiscArg1", "-MiscArg2", "-MiscArg3", "-MiscArg4",
  350: 		       "-MiscArg5", "-MiscArg6"],
  351: 		      Misc),
  352:     verify_args(["+XtraArg1", "+XtraArg2", "+XtraArg3", "+XtraArg4",
  353: 		       "+XtraArg5", "+XtraArg6"],
  354: 		      Extra),
  355:     ok.
  356: 
  357: %% Make sure "erl -detached" survives when parent process group gets killed
  358: otp_7461(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  359:     case os:type() of
  360:     	{unix,_} ->
  361: 	    {NetStarted, _} = net_kernel:start([test_server, shortnames]),
  362: 	    try
  363: 		net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
  364: 		register(otp_7461, self()),
  365: 
  366: 		otp_7461_do(Config)
  367: 	    after
  368: 		catch unregister(otp_7461),
  369: 	        catch net_kernel:monitor_nodes(false),
  370: 	        case NetStarted of
  371: 		    ok -> net_kernel:stop();
  372: 		    _ -> ok
  373: 		end
  374: 	    end;
  375: 	_ ->
  376: 	    {skip,"Only on Unix."}
  377:     end.
  378: 
  379: otp_7461_do(Config) ->
  380:     io:format("alive=~p node=~p\n",[is_alive(), node()]),
  381:     TestProg = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "erlexec_tests"]),
  382:     {ok, [[ErlProg]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  383:     Cmd = TestProg ++ " " ++ ErlProg ++
  384: 	" -detached -sname " ++ get_nodename(otp_7461) ++
  385: 	" -setcookie " ++ atom_to_list(erlang:get_cookie()) ++
  386: 	" -pa " ++ filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)) ++
  387: 	" -s erlexec_SUITE otp_7461_remote init " ++ atom_to_list(node()),
  388: 
  389:     %% otp_7461 --------> erlexec_tests.c --------> cerl -detached
  390:     %%          open_port                 fork+exec
  391: 
  392:     io:format("spawn port prog ~p\n",[Cmd]),
  393:     Port = open_port({spawn, Cmd}, [eof]),
  394: 
  395:     io:format("Wait for node to connect...\n",[]),
  396:     {nodeup, Slave} = receive Msg -> Msg
  397: 			    after 20*1000 -> timeout end,
  398:     io:format("Node alive: ~p\n", [Slave]),
  399: 
  400:     pong = net_adm:ping(Slave),
  401:     io:format("Ping ok towards ~p\n", [Slave]),
  402: 
  403:     Port ! { self(), {command, "K"}}, % Kill child process group
  404:     {Port, {data, "K"}} = receive Msg2 -> Msg2 end,
  405:     port_close(Port),
  406: 
  407:     %% Now the actual test. Detached node should still be alive.
  408:     pong = net_adm:ping(Slave),
  409:     io:format("Ping still ok towards ~p\n", [Slave]),
  410: 
  411:     %% Halt node
  412:     rpc:cast(Slave, ?MODULE, otp_7461_remote, [[halt, self()]]),
  413: 
  414:     {nodedown, Slave} = receive
  415:                             Msg3 -> Msg3
  416:                         after 20*1000 -> timeout
  417:                         end,
  418:     io:format("Node dead: ~p\n", [Slave]),
  419:     ok.
  420: 
  421: 
  422: %% Executed on slave node
  423: otp_7461_remote([init, Master]) ->
  424:     io:format("otp_7461_remote(init,~p) at ~p\n",[Master, node()]),
  425:     net_kernel:connect_node(Master);
  426: otp_7461_remote([halt, Pid]) ->
  427:     io:format("halt order from ~p to node ~p\n",[Pid,node()]),
  428:     halt().
  429: 
  430: %% Check +zdbbl flag
  431: zdbbl_dist_buf_busy_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  432:     LimKB = 1122233,
  433:     LimB = LimKB*1024,
  434:     {ok,[[PName]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  435:     SNameS = "erlexec_test_02",
  436:     SName = list_to_atom(SNameS++"@"++
  437:                          hd(tl(string:lexemes(atom_to_list(node()),"@")))),
  438:     Cmd = PName ++ " -sname "++SNameS++" -setcookie "++
  439:         atom_to_list(erlang:get_cookie()) ++
  440: 	" +zdbbl " ++ integer_to_list(LimKB),
  441:     open_port({spawn,Cmd},[]),
  442:     pong = loop_ping(SName,40),
  443:     LimB = rpc:call(SName,erlang,system_info,[dist_buf_busy_limit]),
  444:     ok = cleanup_node(SNameS, 10),
  445:     ok.
  446: 
  447: long_path_env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  448:     BinPath = os:getenv("BINDIR"),
  449:     ActualPath = os:getenv("PATH"),
  450: 
  451:     PathComponents = string:split(ActualPath, pathsep(), all),
  452:     ActualPathNoBinPath = path_var_join(lists:filter(fun (Path) ->
  453:                                                           Path =/= BinPath
  454:                                                   end, PathComponents)),
  455:     ct:log("BINDIR: ~ts", [BinPath]),
  456:     ct:log("PATH: ~ts", [ActualPath]),
  457: 
  458:     LongPath = lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(10240, "x")),
  459:     {ok, [[PName]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  460:     Cmd = PName ++ " -noshell -eval 'io:format(\"~ts\", [os:getenv(\"PATH\")]),erlang:halt()'",
  461: 
  462:     compare_erl_path(Cmd, BinPath, ActualPath),
  463:     compare_erl_path(Cmd, BinPath, path_var_join([ActualPath, LongPath])),
  464:     compare_erl_path(Cmd, BinPath, path_var_join([ActualPath, LongPath, BinPath])),
  465:     compare_erl_path(Cmd, BinPath, path_var_join([BinPath, ActualPath, LongPath])),
  466:     compare_erl_path(Cmd, BinPath, path_var_join([BinPath, ActualPath, LongPath, BinPath])),
  467: 
  468:     Output = compare_erl_path(Cmd, BinPath, path_var_join([ActualPathNoBinPath, LongPath])),
  469:     ?assertEqual(string:find(Output, LongPath), LongPath),
  470: 
  471:     ok.
  472: 
  473: long_path_env_when_rootdir_not_present(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  474:     BinPath = os:getenv("BINDIR"),
  475:     RootPath = os:getenv("ROOTDIR"),
  476:     RootPathWithBin = filename:join(RootPath, "bin"),
  477:     ActualPath = os:getenv("PATH"),
  478:     LongPathLength = 10240,
  479: 
  480:     LongPath = lists:flatten(lists:duplicate(LongPathLength, "x")),
  481:     {ok, [[PName]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  482:     Cmd = "\"" ++ filename:join(RootPathWithBin, PName) ++ "\"" ++ " -noshell -eval 'io:format(\"~ts\", [os:getenv(\"PATH\")]),erlang:halt()'",
  483: 
  484:     PathComponents = string:split(ActualPath, pathsep(), all),
  485:     ActualPathNoRoot = path_var_join(lists:filter(fun (Path) ->
  486:         (Path =/= RootPathWithBin) and (Path =/= (RootPathWithBin ++ "/")) and (Path =/= BinPath)
  487:     end, PathComponents)),
  488: 
  489:     os:putenv("PATH", path_var_join([ActualPathNoRoot, LongPath, LongPath])),
  490:     Output = os:cmd(Cmd),
  491: 
  492:     ?assertEqual(string:length(string:find(Output, LongPath ++ pathsep() ++ LongPath)), (LongPathLength * 2) + string:length(pathsep())),
  493:     ok.
  494: 
  495: compare_erl_path(Cmd, BinPath, Path) ->
  496:     os:putenv("PATH", Path),
  497:     Output = os:cmd(Cmd),
  498:     % BinPath is at the front of PATH and nowhere else
  499:     ?assertEqual(string:find(Output, BinPath ++ ":"), Output),
  500:     ?assertEqual(string:find(Output, ":" ++ BinPath), nomatch),
  501:     Output.
  502: 
  503: pathsep() ->
  504:     case os:type() of
  505:         {win32, _} -> ";";
  506:         _ -> ":"
  507:     end.
  508: 
  509: path_var_join(Paths) ->
  510:     lists:concat(lists:join(pathsep(), Paths)).
  511: 
  512: 
  513: %%
  514: %% Utils
  515: %%
  516: 
  517: save_env() ->
  518:     {erl_flags,
  519:      os:getenv("ERL_AFLAGS"),
  520:      os:getenv("ERL_FLAGS"),
  521:      os:getenv("ERL_" ++ erlang:system_info(otp_release) ++ "_FLAGS"),
  522:      os:getenv("ERL_ZFLAGS"),
  523:      os:getenv("PATH")}.
  524: 
  525: restore_env(EVar, false) when is_list(EVar) ->
  526:     restore_env(EVar, "");
  527: restore_env(EVar, "") when is_list(EVar) ->
  528:     case os:getenv(EVar) of
  529:     false -> ok;
  530:     "" -> ok;
  531:     " " -> ok;
  532:     _ -> os:putenv(EVar, " ")
  533:     end;
  534: restore_env(EVar, Value) when is_list(EVar), is_list(Value) ->
  535:     case os:getenv(EVar) of
  536:     Value -> ok;
  537:     _ -> os:putenv(EVar, Value)
  538:     end.
  539: 
  540: restore_env({erl_flags, AFlgs, Flgs, RFlgs, ZFlgs, Path}) ->
  541:     restore_env("ERL_AFLAGS", AFlgs),
  542:     restore_env("ERL_FLAGS", Flgs),
  543:     restore_env("ERL_"++erlang:system_info(otp_release) ++ "_FLAGS", RFlgs),
  544:     restore_env("ERL_ZFLAGS", ZFlgs),
  545:     restore_env("PATH", Path),
  546:     ok.
  547: 
  548: privfile(Name, Config) ->
  549:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  550: 		   atom_to_list(proplists:get_value(testcase, Config)) ++ "." ++ Name]).
  551: 
  552: write_file(FileName, Frmt) ->
  553:     write_file(FileName, Frmt, []).
  554: 
  555: write_file(FileName, Frmt, Args) ->
  556:     {ok, File} = file:open(FileName, [write]),
  557:     io:format(File, Frmt, Args),
  558:     ok = file:close(File).
  559: 
  560: verify_args([], _Ys) ->
  561:     ok;
  562: verify_args(Xs, []) ->
  563:     exit({args_not_found_in_order, Xs});
  564: verify_args([X|Xs], [Y|Ys]) ->
  565:     case string:equal(string:replace(X,"\r\n","\n"),string:replace(Y,"\r\n","\n")) of
  566:         true ->
  567:             verify_args(Xs,Ys);
  568:         false ->
  569:             verify_args(Xs,[Y|Ys])
  570:     end.
  571: 
  572: verify_not_args(Xs, Ys) ->
  573:     lists:foreach(fun (X) ->
  574: 			  case lists:member(X, Ys) of
  575: 			      true -> exit({arg_present, X});
  576: 			      false -> ok
  577: 			  end
  578: 		  end, Xs).
  579: 
  580: emu_args(CmdLineArgs) ->
  581:     emu_args(CmdLineArgs, []).
  582: 
  583: emu_args(CmdLineArgs, Opts) ->
  584:     io:format("CmdLineArgs = ~ts, Opts = ~p~n", [CmdLineArgs, Opts]),
  585:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  586:     EmuCL = os:cmd(Erl ++ " -emu_qouted_cmd_exit " ++ CmdLineArgs),
  587: %    ct:pal("EmuCL = ~ts", [EmuCL]),
  588:     case lists:member(return_output, Opts) of
  589:         true ->
  590:             EmuCL;
  591:         false ->
  592:             split_emu_clt(string:split(string:trim(EmuCL,both,"\n \""), "\" \"", all))
  593:     end.
  594: 
  595: split_emu_clt(EmuCLT) ->
  596:     split_emu_clt(EmuCLT, [], [], [], emu).
  597: 
  598: split_emu_clt([], _Emu, _Misc, _Extra, emu) ->
  599:     exit(bad_cmd_line);
  600: split_emu_clt([], Emu, Misc, Extra, _Type) ->
  601:     {lists:reverse(Emu), lists:reverse(Misc), lists:reverse(Extra)};
  602: 
  603: split_emu_clt(["--"|As], Emu, Misc, Extra, emu) ->
  604:     split_emu_clt(As, Emu, Misc, Extra, misc);
  605: split_emu_clt([A|As], Emu, Misc, Extra, emu = Type) ->
  606:     split_emu_clt(As, [A|Emu], Misc, Extra, Type);
  607: 
  608: split_emu_clt(["-extra"|As], Emu, Misc, Extra, misc) ->
  609:     split_emu_clt(As, Emu, Misc, Extra, extra);
  610: split_emu_clt([A|As], Emu, Misc, Extra, misc = Type) ->
  611:     split_emu_clt(As, Emu, [A|Misc], Extra, Type);
  612: 
  613: split_emu_clt([A|As], Emu, Misc, Extra, extra = Type) ->
  614:     split_emu_clt(As, Emu, Misc, [A|Extra], Type).
  615: 
  616: 
  617: get_nodename(T) ->
  618:     atom_to_list(T)
  619: 	++ "-"
  620: 	++ atom_to_list(?MODULE)
  621: 	++ "-"
  622: 	++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(seconds))
  623: 	++ "-"
  624: 	++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])).
